page.title: 07Industry _ Past and present.
page.content: There is a large piece of industrial archaeology in Chilton Trinity village.Known to older local residents as 'the building' it once housed a roofing tile works. Bridgwater tiles were world renowned. Now it is divided up to accomodate a number of small manufacturing and servicing industries including custom_built fibre glass bulk liquid containers, commercial vehicle servicing and a coal merchants yard. On the east bank of the river approx.33 hectares of hitherto wasteland is now covered by small and medium_sized industrial units ranging from a heavy plant hire and sales firm to a factory producing plastic beakers for use in automatic vending machines.
